sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The reigne of King Henry the Second written in seaven bookes. By his Majesties command. May, Thomas, 1595-1650. Vaughan, Robert, engraver.
[216] p. : port. (metal cut)
Printed by A[ugustine] M[atthewes and John Beale] for Benjamin Fisher, dwelling in Aldersgate-streete at the signe of the Talbot, London : 1633.
Dedication signed: Tho. May. In verse. The portrait is signed: RVaughan fecit. Printers' names from STC. Signatures: [A]⁴ B-O. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. "The description of King Henry the Second, with a short survey of the changes in his reigne", N1-O1; "The single, and comparative characters of Henry the sonne, and Richard", O3-7; both in prose. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
The reigne of King Henry the Second written in seaven bookes. By his Majesties command. May, Thomas, 1595-1650. Vaughan, Robert, engraver.
[216] p. : port. (metal cut)
Printed by A[ugustine] M[atthewes and John Beale] for Benjamin Fisher, dwelling in Aldersgate-streete at the signe of the Talbot, London : 1633.
Dedication signed: Tho. May. In verse. The portrait is signed: RVaughan fecit. Printers' names from STC. Signatures: [A]⁴ B-O. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. "The description of King Henry the Second, with a short survey of the changes in his reigne", N1-O1; "The single, and comparative characters of Henry the sonne, and Richard", O3-7; both in prose. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Benjamin Fisher
A[ugustine] M[atthewes
John Beale]
Aldersgate-streete at the signe of the Talbot
